Class FrontEnd

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • FrontEnd

  • public class FrontEnd
extends javafx.application.Application

    FrontEnd

    This class contains all the front end/client code for Rock Buddy

    Last Updated 9/11/23

      • start

        public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
        This method is used to build the nodes used in the JavaFx program. The methods put together the global variable mainPane's top, center, and bottom sections. It then places that mainPane in a scene, that scene on a stage, and finally that stage is displayed.
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application
        Parameters:
        primaryStage - (Stage; stage the scene is placed on)

      • buildAddSamplePane

        public javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane buildAddSamplePane()
                                                  throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method builds and returns the BorderPane that displays the add sample form. It includes all input objects, labels, and textfields. the TextFields are displayed based on the general type selected, and the buttons call their respective methods.
        Returns:
        borderPane (BorderPane; the pane that the add sample form is built on)
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • buildCollectionPane

        public javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane buildCollectionPane()
        This method builds and returns the BorderPane that displays the view collection table. It includes the table, and the inputs associated such as the edit, remove, and view buttons, the filter menu, and the fossil filter radio buttons.
        Returns:
        pane (BorderPane; the pane that the table and inputs are built upon)

      • buildEditSamplePane

        public javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane buildEditSamplePane(Sample sample)
                                                   throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method builds and returns the BorderPane that displays the edit sample form. It includes all input objects, labels, and textfields. The TextFields are displayed based on the general type selected, and the buttons call their respective methods.
        Parameters:
        sample - (Sample; the sample to be edited)
        Returns:
        borderPane (BorderPane; the pane the form is built upon)
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

        Parameters:

      • addSample

        public void addSample()
               throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method is called when the add sample button is clicked. It builds a borderPane using the buildAddSamplePane method, places that pane on a scrollpane, styles it, adds it to a scene, adds that scene to a stage, which is finally displayed.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • viewCollection

        public void viewCollection()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        This method is called when a view collection button is clicked. It updates the global Object collection, by sending a sample to the server w the corresponding sendCollectionCode, so the backend knows to start sending samples. The updateCollection method is called to accept those samples. Once the collection has been updated, the buildCollectionPane is called, which returns a BorderPane. That pane is added displayed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • editSample

        public void editSample()
                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method is called when an edit Sample button is clicked. It calls upon the buildEditSamplePane and displays the returned BorderPane.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • viewSample

        public void viewSample(Sample sample)
                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method is called when a view sample button is clicked. It calls upon the buildViewSamplePane and displays the returned BorderPane.
        Parameters:
        sample - (Sample; this
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • submitSample

        public void submitSample(Sample sample)
        This method is called when the submit sample button is clicked. It sends the input sample to the server and displays a window saying the sample was submitted.
        Parameters:
        sample - (Sample; the sample to be sent to the server)

      • generateId

        public java.lang.String generateId(int rockType)
        This method is called when a user adds a sample. It generates and returns an id to be used if no id is input or if the id matches one already used in the collection. The Id is generated by the number of samples in the collection with the same rock type as the sample.
        Parameters:
        rockType - (int; the rocktype of the sample in int form (0 = sed, 1 = ign, 2 = meta, 3 = unknown))
        Returns:
        generatedId (String; the auto generated id.)

      • messageAndOKButtonPane

        public void messageAndOKButtonPane(java.lang.String message,
                                   java.lang.String title)
        This method displays a new window with a short message and an OK button. The message and the window title are passed as parameters.
        Parameters:
        message -
        title -

      • areYouSurePane

        public javafx.scene.layout.VBox areYouSurePane(Sample sampleToBeDeleted)
        This method builds and returns a VBox that contains an are you sure message along with a final delete and a go back button. The final delete calls the method to send the sample to be deleted and reopens the view collection window. The go back button closes the window and reopens the view collection window.
        Parameters:
        sampleToBeDeleted - (Sample; the sample to be deleted.)
        Returns:
        vBox (VBox; the box containing the label and buttons.)

      • addPhotoWindow

        public void addPhotoWindow(boolean addSuccessful)
        This method displays a window that lets the user know if the photo they tried to add to the sample was successful or not.
        Parameters:
        addSuccessful - (boolean; true if the action was successful, false if the file path entered could not be found.)

      • removeImageWindow

        public void removeImageWindow(boolean removeSuccessful)
        This method displays a window that lets the user know if the photo they tried to remove from the sample was successful or not.
        Parameters:
        removeSuccessful - (boolean; true if the action was successful, false if the file path entered could not be found.)

      • selectASample

        public void selectASample()
        This method displays a window with a table containing all the samples' names and id. The user selects an id and clicks the button. When the button is clicked, the global selectedSample is updated to that sample and the editSample method is called.

      • updateCollection

        public void updateCollection()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        This method updates the collection HashMap. It first clears the collection and then listens for data to be sent by the server. Once the type received by the client equals 100, the method ends as all the samples have been sent. The method creates a samplePhotos arrayList of Sample Photos and populates that as well depending on the number of photos (which is also sent as an int by the server), which is then saved to the sample as it's SamplePhotos arraylist, before the sample is saved to the collection HashMap with the sample's ID as the key.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • sendEditedSample

        public void sendEditedSample(Sample editedSample,
                             java.lang.String originalId)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        This method sends the server a sample with the key that indicates to the server to expect a sample to be edited and a string. It then sends a Sample that has been edited and that sample's original ID. The server (BackEnd) removes the sample with the originalId as a key, before adding the editedSample to the .txt file.
        Parameters:
        editedSample - (Sample; the sample that has been edited, to be sent to the server)
        originalId - (String; the original sample's id)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • sendSampleForDeletion

        public void sendSampleForDeletion(Sample sampleToBeDeleted)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        This method sends a sample to the server with the deletedSampleCode so the backend expects another sample that it then removes from the collection. The method then sends the sample to be deleted.
        Parameters:
        sampleToBeDeleted - (Sample; the sample that is sent for deletion.)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
